data.title: Fabulous meal
data.text: My husband and I both had the walleye with the vegetable option. He had well prepared green beans and I had the roasted vegetables. The breadsticks were warm and we also had fresh bread. Great service. Food was excellent.

data.title: Soup and salad
data.text: We ordered the "Endless Soup  and Salad".  Our choice was the Toscana and the salad was the spinach with goat cheese and walnuts.  Both were excellent so we did have seconds.

data.title: Great food & service
data.text: Really enjoyed our first time at Andiamo.  Everyone's meal was great and our server was fantastic.  I had the pasta with shrimp it was great.

data.title: Best take out ever!
data.text: The seafood stuff mushrooms are out of this world!!! Also had the chicken Andiamo and I feel like I can never eat anything else for the rest of my life. If you are there don't pass up the chocolate cake, highly recommend! Really love their new wine list... my family loved the new cocktails, big win!

data.title: Excellent rehearsal dinner
data.text:
Was in Minnesota over this past weekend for our niece , was invited to the rehearsal dinner. We had family style which was unbelievable , plates of pasta, chicken, salad, veggies etc kept coming and coming , food was cooked to perfection ,perfect amount of sauce, spices etc on each dish.
Excellent waiter staff, the resturant was very clean, and packed with people, we look forward to dinner there next time in Minnesota

data.title: Very Good!  Already wanting to go back to try more!
data.text: We were actually going to try a couple of other recommendations but couldn't get in so we searched the web and found this gem of a place and sure glad we did!  It was a very hoppin' place but we only waited a half hour to get in.  The hostess seemed as though she knew everyone that walked through the door so we knew we were at a good place!  The restaurant was pretty noisy but we got seated in an off section so it wasn't so bad.  We had the Ravioli, Chicken Parmigiana, Shirmp Arrabbiata and Fettuccini alla Romano.  They were all amazing except the Fettuccini was pretty bland.  I also have never seen Chicken Parmigiana served without pasta but I am sure they would substitute if you would like it.  The bread they served prior to the meal was really good! Service was very attentive and the price was great!

data.title: Try the semi-private dining area for a small wedding rehearsal dinner
data.text:
Who doesn't love a good wedding rehearsal dinner? Well I do! After a successful pre-ceremony once through, our wedding party and family guests all headed to Andiamo Italian Ristorante in Eagen, Minnesota on Friday September 23rd, 2016.

Andiamo is easy to find and at the busiest time on a Friday night, the parking lot was a bit crowded. The attendants at the door pleasantly pointed us to the "semi-private" group dining area. The "semi-private" dining only comfortably housed about 30, but we had closer to 40 adults and kids trying to eat a meal. This wasn't the restaurant's fault, but just so you know, crowding their party room isn't a good idea.

The atmosphere is clean and naturally dark (what restaurant isn't these days) with simple decorations and a lot of nice wood everywhere. One thing to note is that even in the "semi-private" dining area, the background noise of talking and chatter was very loud. Having a conversation with someone right across the table was a bit tough.

Although we were eating as a group, every table seemed to have a server assigned to assure we had soda and water glasses refilled. We felt forgotten a few times, but we were still having a good time as a group and didn't notice much.

The food served was from a small buffet set up in the corner with pre-dressed creamy Italian romaine salad, a coarsely sauced penne regate pepperoni and sausage main dish, seasoned buttered Italian bread, gluten-free lemon chicken and soft breaksticks. For a brief moment I was worried Andiamo hadn't planned enough food for us, but they kindly refilled the buffet so everyone could eat their fill. I didn't try the chicken or buttered Italian bread, but the salad was fresh and tasty. The pasta main dish was really good and had I been here for just a date night out, I would have ordered this dish and had no regrets. The breadsticks weren't the Fazoli's tender, garlic, salty, buttery sort, but still were plenty tasty.

Food-wise I'd highly recommend a visit to Andiamo, even with the very minimal sample on my dinner plate. Steer clear of busy times, service will be satisfactory, but it won't be a quiet meal to restore your Ch'i.

data.title: Hmm...not quite.
data.text: Noisey and not the romantic ambience I was hoping for but a nice Italian Restaurant with pretty good service.  Not a white tablecloth experience BTW but better than overly casual mom&pop stop.  Extensive menu all seeming in the $14-$20 range if I recall.  Had the Lasagna and their recommended shrimp angel hair pasta entree- name escapes me.  Lasagna was surrounded by an overabundant moat of crushed tomatoes with the lasagna completely lacking in meats and cheese.  We had to actually ask for freshly grated parma vs it being offered at serving.  The shrimp were small, overly garlicky along with the the dish having all but the kitchen sink in it.  The breadsticks were dry, overcooked and goodness seemingly day old whilst the half loaf of bread was moist & fine.  The garlic cheese bread was nice though, perhaps needing a hint of parma and garlic.  Given the lack of meat in all the dishes I would recommend a side of meatballs perhaps to fulfill your protein craving.  I may go back to try the chicken fettuccine yet unsure as neither the hostess nor the waiter recommended such...the waiter encouraged me to select the lasagna instead.  Hmm...with a bit of ambience and food tweaking this place could be a hit for the more refined palate.  Until I hear of such I will try others and return to tried and true outstanding establishments.

data.title: Busy but good
data.text: Went at dinner time on a Friday, very crowded, but did not have to wait long.  Service was excellent and food was tasty.

data.title: Wanted Italian!
data.text:
Made reservation on website. I would suggest it on busier nights. Arrived around 8:45 pm. Only a few tables left from dinner rush. Host sat us immediately. Server was quick to greet us. Friendly yet she seemed a little rushed. Our first visit we would have liked more suggestive and personal service. Ordered drinks and appetizer same time. Added a salad to share when she came back. Salad came before app. She just said salads are faster? Artichoke Dip was different, but good. Salad was delicious and full size perfect to split with 4 people. 
We all ordered Pastas, they do have other choices. All were really good and large portions. We needed boxes, she brought them for us to box. I really feel that servers should offer to box the food. It's classier and our senior guests had difficulty boxing the food. Not sure when this service became extinct. We were offered dessert before we were all finished, we declined and she brought check before last guest was finished? The restaurant atmosphere is nice for dates, nice dinners, family gatherings.
We will go back but won't expect detailed service.

data.title: Fabulous Italian Food from Smiling Staff
data.text: Went there for the first time on a Tuesday night. Made reservations just in case as we heard it was a busy place.  Good thing!  They were packed!  Staff was so pleasant in spite of how busy they were.  Smiles all around and no grumping!  Split the bill as we met another couple there for dinner.  Half price bottle of wine was excellent!  Apothic Red which is a very popular wine these days, and was surprised to see it half price on the menu.  The food was fabulous!  Apps and all!  They also have gluten free options and no frowning about bringing the gluten free menu or answering questions about it.  Family place so a bit noisy and a lot of echo. Very classy décor though.  Would definitely drive out this way to eat again!

data.title: Packed but friendly staff
data.text: Visited at 5 on a Friday and these guys were packed, but the staff was handling the crowd with a smile!   I believe they had a private party going on so perhaps it's not the usual for a Friday..  Our food was wonderful, Spaghetti and meatballs just like home, my mom had a pasta dish with artichokes and my son had ravioli, all dishes were excellent.  I felt the prices were a little steep (esp since food prices are down across the board and the price of fuel remains down), but it seems restaurant prices keep climbing.  Esp at an Italian restaurant where the main ingredient was pasta I felt they were overprices, but, the place has a hip vibe and our food was great.  Will be back again just not as often as I would like.  I would like to say again that the staff, even tho busy, was friendly and quick.

data.title: Great happy hour
data.text: The pizza and salads make a great meal to dine in or out. They have half price wine on select nights too.

data.title: Great service and food!
data.text: Great place to grab a bite to eat. The service is great, the food is very good and the environment is very fitting. We will definitely go back.

data.title: Great spot in the neighborhood!
data.text: We love Andiamo. Very good food, reasonable prices. Great drinks. Great service. What's not to love?!?! The specials are always great and food presentation beautiful. Haven't found anything on the menu I don't like!

data.title: Amazing service and awesome for gluten free
data.text: Absolutely amazing service. We went in with food allergies and the server was extremely educated how to handle allergies.  Explained gluten free toast is prepared separate so no cross contamination.  Put us at ease.  GF pasta is excellent and many GF options.  Truly amazing service.  Food comes out hot and stays hot.  Highly recommend this restaurant.

data.title: An Eagan favorite
data.text:
Andiamo has a lot of good dishes.  I especially recommend the Chicken Andiamo which is served with roasted vegetables.  Tasty and delicate, the chicken has a mixture of interesting toppings-artichokes, capers, etc.    I discovered this item on the menu earlier this year and now have had it on at least three different visits to the restaurant.
For bread lovers, the garlic breadsticks and the Italian bread are very good.

data.title: Delicious Italian food
data.text: I've eaten here many times and it is a true gem. The owner is often there checking in on tables and the service is always fantastic. Their food is truly delicious and it's very reasonably priced. good for casual, fancy, and dates. Always a great experience here.

data.title: A treat!
data.text: Ordered the chicken andiamo and it was perfection!  Tender chicken wth artichokes and capers - so good!  Fostered vegetables were colorful and tasty.  Will definitely be back!

data.title: Happy Hour
data.text: Our group needed a new happy hour spot since Bonfire raised prices. Andiamo has a special happy hour bar menu with full size food specials that are a great deal, along with beer & wine specials. We ordered pizzas, bruschetta and artichoke dip. Everyone was very happy. Faves were the pizza and dip.  We were also served bread. Friendly service, good food, great deal...we will be back!
